pgTitle: List of museums in Georgia (U.S. state)

rows.text: A. H. Stephens State Historic Park Confederate Museum
Adairsville Rail Depot Age of Steam Museum
website, five areas: a traditional farm community of the 1870s, an 1890s progressive farmstead, an industrial sites complex, rural town, Peanut Museum, and the Georgia Museum of Agriculture Center
Includes African, European, and American art
Altama Museum of Art and History
Site of largest Confederate military prison during the American Civil War and National Prisoner of War Museum
19th century plantation with two-story farm house, slave quarters, cook house, corn crib, barn, carriage house, well, and spring house
information, St. Simons Island plantation history and Methodist history
information, information, tourist information center and museum
Augusta Canal National Heritage Area Interpretive Center
History of the canal, textile mills along the canal, mill workers, hydroelectricity, canal boat toursa
Autrey Mill Nature Preserve and Heritage Center
Nature preserve, heritage village, farm museum, live animals and dioramas
Beach Institute of African American Culture
website, African-American art, folk art and culture
Beulah Rucker Museum and Education Center
Contemporary American Western art, Civil War art, Presidential letters and portraits
Boyhood Home of President Woodrow Wilson
Features several historic houses and structures
website, country doctor's house and office
C. E. Blevins Avian Learning Center
website, also natural history, features handmade bird egg replicas of over 1200 birds
Nature preserve with exhibits on wildlife and hunting
Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park
Early 19th century Cherokee Indian plantation home
website, serves as the Athens Welcome Center and 1820s house museum
American art and regional culture and history
Natural and cultural history of the island
Includes artifacts and equipment from the 1836 gold rush
website, 1820s period Isaiah Davenport House, operated by the Historic Savannah Foundation
Douglas County Museum of History and Art
website, local history, art and antiques
website, Civil War uniforms, history and memorabilia
information, operated by the Laurens County Historical Society
website, nature center with natural history and science exhibits
website, gallery of the Bainbridge-Decatur County Arts Council
Folk Pottery Museum of Northeast Georgia
Visitor center with archaeological artifacts and exhibits about the 18th-century fort and town
Civil War earthwork fortification and museum
American Revolutionary fort site and museum
Civil War fort and museum with weekend living history demonstrations
website, history of the Fort Stewart Military Reservation
Georgia College & State University Natural History Museum
website, features dinosaurs, fossils, earth sciences and a planetarium
Georgia Racing Hall of Fame Museum
Georgia Sports Hall of Fame and Museum
website, located in the building where Georgia’s legislators voted to secede from the Union
website, focus on the environment, also operates the Gwinnett History Museum in Lawrenceville and a restored 1930s farm in Duluth
Includes a working grist mill and a museum with agriculture equipment and tools
website, operated by the Hapeville Historical Society
website, located in the Gilmer Arts and Heritage Association building
website, includes over a dozen buildings representing rural coastal African American life after the Civil War
website, includes Gone With the Wind and Civil War memorabilia
website, officially the Jacqueline Casey Hudgens Center for the Arts
website, 19th century period home and offices of Historic Columbus, also known as 700 Broadway
19th century cotton plantation farm with outbuildings
Jefferson Davis Memorial Museum at site where Confederate President Jefferson Davis was captured in 1865
Also known as the Hay House, 1850s Italian Renaissance Revival style mansion with furnishings from many periods
Includes Civil War battleground of the Atlanta Campaign and a museum
website, African-American Savannah and the Sea Islands
website, operated by the Marble Valley Historical Society
website, formerly the Chattahoochee Valley Art Museum
Lamar Dodd School of Art Galleries
website, historic mill with tractor museum
President Franklin Delano Roosevelt's personal retreat
Log Cabin At Milton High School
website, open by appointment with the Alpharetta Historical Society
Lucy Craft Laney Museum of Black History
website, located inside the International Marketplace, metal lunch boxes
website, art exhibits and 19th century Ware-Lyndon House museum
American, European, Asian and African art and sculpture
website, changing exhibits of art and culture, permanent exhibits of local history, decorative arts, antiques, school room
website, 1912 Queen Anne style house, operated by the Alpharetta Historical Society
Botanical gardens with Annabelle Lundy Fetterman Educational Museum featuring a Boehm porcelain collection

website, a unit of the Savannah-Chatham County Public Schools, includes a model of old Savannah, Victorian building architecture and artifacts, the impact of Classical styles on Savannah buildings, a 19th-century period classroom, and the founding of Savannah
Marietta Gone With the Wind Museum: Scarlett on the Square
Maritime Center at Historic Coast Guard Station
Includes 18th and 19th century furnishings and decorative arts
website, art and history of St. Simons Island plantations and landmarks
Museum of History & Holocaust Education, Kennesaw State University
History of the Union and Confederate navies during the Civil War
Neel House Federated Garden Clubs of Macon
website, park includes 1870s log cabin, many historic farm outbuildings, agriculture equipment, animals, print shop museum, antiques, Native American exhibit and more
Website, art work which is international, representational, figurative, and spiritual in nature
Old Campbell County Historical Society Museum
website, operated by the Marble Valley Historical Society
website, farm tools, equipment and home life implements
20th century estate featuring 19th century furniture, porcelain, silver, crystal, and glassware, sporting art and 33 Audubon lithographs, extensive grounds and gardens
information, located in City Hall, history of marble in Georgia
website, Civil War battlefield and museum
website, former gold mine, artifacts and equipment
website, antique airplanes, motors and memorabilia
Ralph Mark Gilbert Civil Rights Museum
website, operated by Historic Columbus, 1850-1870 house museum
website, operated by Cobb Landmarks & Historical Society, 1850s period house
website, includes 19th century Williams-Payne House and outbuildings
Canal history, area history and natural history
Savannah College of Art and Design
website, operated by the Bowdon Area Historical Society, open on special occasions
Ships of the Sea Maritime Museum
Georgia's official transportation history museum, over 90 pieces of rolling stock exhibited on the 30-acre (12 ha) site
website, forest industry in the South
Southern Museum of Civil War and Locomotive History
Railroad and Civil War artifacts, formerly the Kennesaw Civil War Museum
website, artworks and life of German-American Expressionist Steffen Thomas
Includes the Stone Mountain Museum about the mountain's carving and the Civil War, and the open air Antebellum Plantation and Farmyard
Suttons Corner Frontier Country Store Museum
mid-19th-century mansion open for tours and rental
website, open for school groups only
Website, formerly Weinman Mineral Museum, exhibits include minerals, fossils, transportation technology, science playground and a planetarium
website, includes main museum of local history, 1877 middle-class home, 1893 single-lane bowling alley, 1860s log house, 1890s courthouse
website, science, local history and planetarium
Art, history and culture of African Americans
website, local history museum, historic railroad tunnel and train viewing
website, also known as the Lowndes County Historical Museum
Valdosta State University Fine Arts Gallery
information, photos, also known as the Greene County Historical Society Museum
Walker County Regional Heritage and Model Train Museum
information, local history, railroad history and model trains
website, operated by Historic Columbus, early 19th-century house
website, local and natural history, includes replicas of old stores, a barber shop and a bank, and dinosaur models
website, operated by Historic Columbus, 1840s farm house
World War II Flight Training Museum
Former 18th century plantation site and museum
